monogr.title: The new found vvorlde, or Antarctike : wherin is contained wo [n] derful and strange things, as well of humaine creatures, as beastes, fishes, foules, and serpents, trées, plants, mines of golde and siluer: garnished with many learned aucthorities, trauailed and written in the French tong, by that excellent learned man, master Andrevve Theuet. And now newly translated into Englishe, wherein is reformed the errours of the auncient cosmographers
monogr.author: Thevet, André

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: In prayse of the Author.
div.l: THe farthest scope of heauen and earth also,
The subtile stremes inclosed in the grounde,
The mighty Mines of Metals that doe gro
In lurking vaynes, that hidden are profounde,
The Cristall pearle, the Diamond so fayre,
The floting fish of diuers kindes of hew,
Of diuers soiles, to which thou mayst repayre,
Of other landes that yet to vs be new,
Hath Theuet here through trauell his and payne,
Educted forth, to satisfie thy minde,
Who well deserues thy thankefull speech to gayne,
As single eye of iudgement thyne shall finde.
Therefore as craues this his deserued stile,
So of his worke let iudgement thyne procede,
Who of good will this libell did compile,
To further thee, that tooke the same to rede.
